Authors: Susanto R., Oktavianus W., Prayogo W., Budijono S., Wijaya R.
Title: Wearable Device for Restaurant Operational that Employs People with Hearing Impairment
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Oktavianus, W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Prayogo, W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Budijono, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Speed in serving consumers is one of the top priorities in restaurants. To provide fast and precise service, it needed a device that is able to help the operational system at restaurant. This research focus on creating a device that can help operational system at restaurant that can be controlled using the smartphone. The device is designed to combine several components that were merged into a wearable device. The result is wearable devices that can last 7 hours 34 minutes with 2 hours charging time, average operating distance 35.3 m, and 5% error glitch. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Audition; Charging time; Android; Firebase; Hearing impairments; Operational systems; Research focus; Restaurant; Wearable devices; Wearable technology

Authors: Prabowo R.E., Julian N., Mae J., Susanto R., Hedwig R.
Title: Navigation assistant for vision impaired people using ultra sonic (sonar vision) and global positioning system (GPS)
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Prabowo, R.E., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Julian, N., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mae, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: People with low vision usually use stick to find their way or to face an obstacle in front of them. However, this detection only can be felt as long as the length of the stick from its handle is as far as the reach of the hand. Seeing this limitation, a set of sonar vision was made using sonar sensor, which equipped as a wristwatch and a buckle of a belt. The sonar vision was designed to detect an obstacle for up to 3 meters away. A hundred low vision people already got the benefit of this system, which 84% of them felt that the sonar vision helped them in the navigation. The new design based on the feedback is presented in this paper, which is equipped with GPS for positioning information. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: blind; GPS; low vision; obstacle detection; sonar
Index Keywords: Felt; Felts; Obstacle detectors; Sonar; blind; Low vision; Obstacle detection; Positioning information; Sonar sensor; Vision impaired; Global positioning system

Authors: Pratama B.W., Glenn F., Atmadja W., Liawatimena S., Susanto R.
Title: Design and Implementation of Artificial Grow Light for Germination and Vegetative Growth
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pratama, B.W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Glenn, F., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Atmadja, W., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Liawatimena, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K H. Syahdan No. 9 Kemanggisan, Palmerah Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to build artificial grow light using LED for growing leafy vegetables from germination to harvesting (vegetative growth). Plants need to capture photons as energy for photosynthesis in 400nm - 780nm spectrum. Different plant species will respond differently to specific light spectrum. Many studies have been done to find optimal light spectrum for plant growth, but there are still many researches to be done because there are still many combinations of light and plants species to be discovered. Specific light spectra combination is called light recipe. This research will help botanist to discover new light recipe for plant species by mixing 6 light spectra with individual intensity and time control. The developed grow light system has graphical user interface that run in Android tablet, and uses MQTT protocol for communication between android application and grow light system. Light recipe and setting are stored in database and the system also has light sensor to monitor light environmental conditions. Grow light consists of 6 types of 3W high power LED with specific color spectrum: Royal Blue, Deep Red, Ultraviolet, Full Spectrum, Far Red, and Natural White. Testing result shows that the system can produce uniform light distribution across the 50 x 50 cm grow area on average 22.6 μmol m-2s-1 using 60° lens. Germination result of lettuce using grow light shows good results compared to sunlight. © 2020 Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Author Keywords: Artificial grow light; LED; MQTT; PAR
Index Keywords: Android (operating system); Cultivation; Graphical user interfaces; Light emitting diodes; Android applications; Design and implementations; Environmental conditions; High power LED; Leafy vegetables; Light distribution; MQTT; Vegetative growth; Light

Authors: Susanto R., Wiedjaja, Anthony J., Jacksen
Title: Comparison of three LoRa devices and its application on street light monitoring system
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wiedjaja, Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Anthony, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Jacksen, Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This paper discusses implementation of Long Range (LoRa) networks as an Internet of Things (IoT) objects especially on street light monitoring. Low Powered Wide Area Network (LPWAN) is used as a communication network. LoRa devices are configured with a frequency of 470 MHz, spread factor 9, bandwidth of 31.25 KHz, and code rate of 4/5. The study found that the UM402 LoRa module has the farthest network range, up to 1 Km. By focusing on a range of up to 250 m, the LoRa Dragino shield has the fastest data packet delivery time at 0.77 s. UM402 LoRa module has the largest Received Signal Strength Indication (RSSI) value at 50m, it is -34. All LoRa devices used in this research can operate well at the ideal distance of street lights (35 m). © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: dan Low Powered Wide Area Network; Internet of Things; Long Range
Index Keywords: Internet of things; Low power electronics; Data packet delivery; Internet of Things (IOT); ITS applications; Light monitoring; Long Range; Network range; Received signal strength indication; Spread factors; Wide area networks

Authors: Tandil R., Yapson J., Atmadja W., Liawatimena S., Susanto R.
Title: Hydroponic nutrient mixing system based on STM32
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Department of Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tandil, R., Department of Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Yapson, J., Department of Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Atmadja, W., Department of Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Liawatimena, S., Department of Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Susanto, R., Department of Computer Engineering, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Hydroponics nutrient mixing system based on STM32 is a device to produce hydroponic nutrient solution, according to individual plant nutrient recipe, automatically by using individual dosing pump for each fertilizer concentrate. Nutrient recipes and fertilizer database are stored in Raspberry PI. The system will compute the recipe and translate to the required individual concentrates' volume, then send command to dosing pump controller. Dosing pump controller will then send command to 10 dosing pump motor drivers to pump each fertilizer concentrate according to the volume measurement to produce the nutrient solution. The core of dosing pump controller is a 32bit microcontroller development board Nucleo-F446RE from ST Microelectronic, ample to control 10 dosing pump drivers. Each of the dosing pumps will be equipped with fertilizer concentration with maximum solubility. The system has user friendly graphical user interface using 7" graphics LCD. To produce specific solution strength, system can fill in water through water pump and use water level sensor to measure the volume, this process is controlled by proportional controller. The output of the mixing process can be hydroponic A and B mixed concentrate solution, or direct solution. For concentrate solution user must dilute A and B concentrate with water. The system has been tested 9 times and produce maximum 9% error. Water filling system accuracy test for 5-liter water volume with Kp 10000 has 2.784% error. © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: concentrate; Hydroponic; proportional controller; Raspberry PI; STM32

Authors: Susanto R., Wijaya R., Talok A., Hartono J.R., Hedwig R., Lukas J., Dewanto S.
Title: Stabilizing system for quadrotor copter like flying robot by using proportional-integral-derivative (PID) controller
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wijaya, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Talok, A., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hartono, J.R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Lukas, J., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dewanto, S., Computer Engineering Department, Faculty of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this research, a quardrotor copter like a flying robot is developed with its capability to stabilize itself during the steady flying in a determined position. In order to gain its stability, intentionally a simple filter with a low error rate of 1.67% during its full operation was placed. The time consumed during its steady flying in the air took approximately one second with the height of flying around 1 to 5 meters above the earth. © 2018 Institute of Physics Publishing. All rights reserved.

Title: Designing a monitoring system to locate a child in a certain closed area using RFID sensor and android smartphone
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hutabarat, D.P., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Susanto, R., Bina Nusantara University, Jl. K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: With the emergence of many children's playground located in a closed area as Kidzania in Jakarta, and Trans Studio in Bandung, we need a system that can help parents or a nanny to know the position / location of the children when they are playing at the venue. The location that is in the closed area and consists of lots of room to play therein will have many challenges when it is developed by using the Global Positioning System (GPS). In the developed system is also necessary to know the location of the children monitored in real time. The use of Radio Frequency ID (RFID) is expected to answer the needs mentioned above. The system developed consists of RFID readers that is installed at the entrance or exit, RFID tags that is carried by the child, a database server that is used to upload data from RFID readers and also an application that is installed on a smart phone that is used to upload the registration data to the database server and download data from the database server to be displayed on the smartphone. Application that is developed to build this system is also equipped with other features such as user info and add friend. User info is used to determine the time of the last tapping did by the child. Add Friend is used to add a child that is to be monitored into the system. In this application, the number of children that can be monitored is limited to 5 children. With accuracy up to 100% at the time of tapping and mapping, systems and applications are developed is reliable to answer the needs. © 2017 ACM.
Author Keywords: Android smart phone; RFID; System monitoring

Title: Low cost vision-based multi-lane road marker recognition and vehicle pose estimation
Affiliations: Automotive and Robotics Engineering, BINUS ASO School of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Alam Sutera, Serpong, Indonesia; Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Tan, S., Automotive and Robotics Engineering, BINUS ASO School of Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Alam Sutera, Serpong, Indonesia; Susanto, R., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: vehicle usually needs high detection rate for reliability. However the implementation can be limited by the calculation power available in the vehicle. This paper reports an improvement of our previous approach while keeping the processing power low. The algorithm proposed in this paper avoid heavy pixel-by-pixel image processing of the captured image, it works mostly on the detected line segments instead of the image. The proposed algorithm is also more global, capable in recognizing multiple lane markers and estimating the position of the vehicle on a multi-lane road. The algorithm is evaluated using miniature road and miniature vehicle for various poses. The recognition rate and the estimation accuracy are shown to be much higher with only 1% failure rate compared to the previous approach in [12] or [13].
Author Keywords: Hough transform; Inverse perspective mapping; Multi-lane recognition; Vehicle pose estimation
References: Guzzella, L., The Automobile of the Future -Option for Efficient Individual Mobility," IEEE Control Applications, (CCA) & Intelligent Control, (ISIC). Title: Compressive sensing-based image encryption with optimized sensing matrix
Source title: Proceeding - IEEE CYBERNETICSCOM 2013: IEEE International Conference on Computational Intelligence and Cybernetics
Affiliations: Department of Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Endra, Department of Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Susanto, R., Department of Computer Engineering, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The dimentional reduction of the signal can be obtained by projecting the signal into a sensing matrix, the technique is known as Compressive Sensing (CS). The CS also provides a mechanism for data security (encryption) because the signal can only be reconstructed if the dictionary and the sensing matrix are known. This technique is better compared to the conventional technique because the compression and encryption is done simultaneously through the signal projection into the sensing matrix. Moreover the signal projection into the sensing matrix is relatively simple and doesn't need heavy computational load so it will be very effective to implement in a portable device. We proposed a scheme of simultaneous image compression-encryption based on CS by using a novel method of optimized sensing matrix. The simulation results showed that by using optimized sensing matrix improved the quality of reconstructed image compared with random sensing matrix that is usually used in CS-based encryption. © 2013 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Artificial intelligence; Signal reconstruction; Compressive sensing; Computational loads; Conventional techniques; Image encryptions; Portable device; Quality of reconstructed images; Signal projection; Cryptography
